List all remotes associated with current repo
What is a branch?
cards.back: A branch in Git is simply a lightweight movable pointer to one of these commits. The default branchname in Git is master. As you initially make commits, you're given a master branch that points to the last commit you made. Every time you commit, it moves forward automatically.

cards.front: How is a branch created?
cards.back: A branch is created when you fork a repository.

cards.front: List branches and remote branches being tracked.
Shows all branches local and remote
Shows all commits.
To add a local to a repository
Adding a new extra remote to repo(not origin)
cards.back:
git remote add "anyname"  https://github.com/.....
git remote -v (will show the anyname and path of remote, Still need to fetch)
git fetch anyname

cards.front: To push local changes to origin (could be asked for id/password) -pushing.
Adding a local to a repository -pushing.
cards.back:
git remote -vv
git remote add origin
git push --set-upstream origin master
